item.title: Warning sign for Railton Road LTN entry painted over, 4th September
item.description:
The signs warning drivers in advance that they are about to enter a prohibited stretch of the Railton road LTN at Herne Hill are not clearly visible. The sign shown in the photographs has been painted over with white paint. There is another warning sign on the opposite side of the road, but the T junction symbol is bent at a sideways angle, making it appear that the warning concerns a left turning. The effect is that a driver may not know in time that they are about to enter a prohibited stretch of the Railton road LTN. The start of the prohibited area itself does have a sign but there is no turning area or physical barrier, and no advance warning.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Railton Road, Herne Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter Collection, 4th September
item.description:
When are the bins going to be emptied in Dallin Road? I am not aware that the road is closed. Bins are overglowing. I had to take my own black bags to the recycling centre. I will be requesting a council tax refund for no statutory service provision.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dallin Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the pavement in front of entrance to Argo House Block A/ Unit A, 4th September
item.description:
Unfortunately, there is now further dumping of rubbish which needs to be collected. Given its repeat location, it appears to be the same person doing the fly tipping. Would be grateful if you would kindly arrange for a crew to clear the area before others start dumping their rubbish on to the same spot and thus encourage further rodent infestation in the area. Many thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Park Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Street sweeper didn’t clean rotting fruit, 4th September
item.description:
Fruit tree lined street covered in fallen rotting fruit. Pathways have become slippery from detritus. Second week in a row street cleaner has not removed it. Reported previously before no action taken

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Combermere Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on wall and nearby tag sprayed on pavement box by entrance door on same street. Located at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG, 4th September
item.description:
Graffiti has been sprayed against a cream wall and further down a graffiti tag which spells SS has been sprayed on a grey pavement box. Both located at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. Please can the graffiti be painted over. They have been up for just over a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296,298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
